title: Travis Criteria
description: Predicts risk of needing colectomy with severe ulcerative colitis. Used on day 3 of treatment for acute severe ulcerative colitis to predict failure of medical therapy.

parameters.name: stool_frequency
parameters.description: Number of stools on day 3 of treatment

ranges.interpretation: Patient has low risk of needing colectomy. Continue current medical therapy with close monitoring. Ensure appropriate follow-up and maintenance therapy on discharge.

Patient has high risk of needing colectomy. Consider early surgical consultation and other therapies including surgery. Intensify medical therapy or consider second-line treatments (cyclosporine, infliximab) if not already initiated.

references: Travis SP, Farrant JM, Ricketts C, et al. Predicting outcome in severe ulcerative colitis. Gut. 1996;38(6):905-910.

Lynch RW, Churchhouse AMD, Protheroe A, Arnott IDR, UK IBD Audit Steering Group. Predicting outcome in acute severe ulcerative colitis: comparison of the Travis and Ho scores using UK IBD audit data. Aliment Pharmacol Ther. 2016;43(11):1132-1141.
Pabla BS, Schwartz DA. Assessing severity of disease in patients with ulcerative colitis. Gastroenterol Clin North Am. 2020;49(4):671-688.
formula: High risk if: (>8 bowel movements) OR (3-8 bowel movements AND CRP >45 mg/L)
notes: Used on day 3 of treatment for acute severe ulcerative colitis
Helps predict failure of medical therapy and need for colectomy
High risk patients should be considered for early surgical consultation
85% specificity for predicting need for colectomy in the original study
